pullRequest.title: Issue #8651: Checkstyle fails on escape '\s' character
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #8651: Checkstyle fails on escape '\s' character
This PR fixes #8651; all we needed to do was add the \s alternative to the STD_ESC lexer rule, so that the STRING_LITERAL rule would recognize this escape.  The text blocks grammar already supported \s, so no changes were necessary there. I have removed the two BeforeExecutionExclusionFileFilter modules specified here from  openjdk14-excluded.files.
Link to passing CI for the two BeforeExecutionExclusionFileFilter modules that have been removed: https://checkstyle.semaphoreci.com/jobs/465adbd8-5https://checkstyle.semaphoreci.com/jobs/465adbd8-57b9-4e87-8fc9-c3c883f2a9ef7b9-4e87-8fc9-c3c883f2a9ef
AST Regression test: https://nmancus1.github.io/diff_escapedS/diff/checkstyle/index.html

nodes.bodyText:
I do not think this annotation is good.
we have git for this, and while we are strict on format for commit messages it is better to keep such information in git (hidden by default). Reader of code should focus on code first, any distractions(extra code lines) should be avoided.
Does it make sense to forbid it by Checkstyle validation ? as illegal class ... if you agree please create issue on this.
the same as we forbid @Test(expected = SomeException.class) annotation of junit , will be enforce at #9137
